website_summaries.verdict: Flexible, breathable, functional, and lightweight, the Zhuanglin water shoe is constructed with a comfortable sock type liner and breathable mesh upper for quick drying.
pros: Quick-drying openwork mesh upper and hole in the sole for water drainage
Super lightweight and very comfortable with a good fit for any foot, including some arch support – missing from many water shoes
Great for multi-use such as kayaking/canoeing
Stylish enough to wear while out and about
cons: Soft sole can wear quickly on pavement/sidewalks
Not a ton of arch support
Rocks can lodge in the openwork pattern in the sole

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are awsome. I took them to Maui and have used them just about everyday. They fit perfectly, have been great on the beach, in the water and aswell just normal use....also in the bamboo forest
customer_reviews.author: Jr.

customer_reviews.title: bought these for my husband and they fit perfect. Read reviews prior to purchase so bought a ...
customer_reviews.text: bought these for my husband and they fit perfect. Read reviews prior to purchase so bought a size down and that was exactly correct. Very lightweight will be great for any water activity. They come in a zip plastic bag I plan to save for when they are wet and we are packing. The only thing is they smell really strong like plastic, so you may want to air them out outside for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A near perfect water sport shoe and also for non water sports
customer_reviews.text: First of all, these shoes run large. This is good because I normally wear 15s and the 14 fit well enough. These are very light and comfortable and the inside feels good on my feet with adequate support. I have had many water shoes that hurt my feet because they are completely flat and these aren't. They are very good looking and if there is any fault it is the elastic laces could be better. I like lock laces so I could be spoiled. When I first tried on the shoe I was thinking these are light like Huaraches. Anyway, I will be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the package the rubber on the bottom was already pealing off
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Insole is of poor construction. That’s just part of the problem
customer_reviews.text: Have two pair of these (size 14) and it looks like I’d have learned from the first pair that the insole wouldn’t hold up. The fabric started coming off the sole on my first wearing. I like the shoe but I can’t recommend them. Sorry. I’m now trying to figure out what to do about the insole. ☹️ Update: I didn’t mention that they stink. And no it’s not my feet. Have tried powder and baking soda and it’s helped some but they still stink. Also the holes in the sole pick up rocks. No way to walk on any gravel without rocks getting in the holes.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Addington

customer_reviews.title: These chafed our ankles.
customer_reviews.text: I've had several pair of water shoes, but these... the elastic around the ankle was not the best. The elastic band was much wider than it needed to be, and of a very rough material with raised stitching. The result: my son and I both bought a pair and within a few minutes of wearing them, our Achilles tendons, both feet, were scraped and chafed to the point that there was a swollen, red, raised and very tender area on our tendons. Had to put ointment and band-aids on them for a few days due to the irritation. I sent these back and got another pair, less costly, but wear much better and more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Rock Magnet
customer_reviews.text: The shoe fits, looks, and sheds water amazing. However it’s a terrible water shoe. The soft holes in the bottom collect every rock you step on. I spent so much time digging rocks from my shoes with a pocket knife, I just went back to using flip flops. I collected rocks at the boat lauch, parking lots, on the sand/rocky pathway to the beach. If there are absolutely no rocks in your path, this shoe would be amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Donovan Iafrate

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for - or maybe a little less.
customer_reviews.text: 20185 model: For $30, I didn’t expect a whole lot. The shoe fits as you’d expect. It’s airy, and I found it to work well at the beach or as a slipper when I have to walk outside my house momentarily. That said, the sole is wearing through already, within about two months, with only light use. Since they started falling apart, I used them on a few beach jogs, which I found to be a decent use. I’ve since bought a more suitable shoe for running on the beach, though. I’m not an expert in the ~$30 water shoe area, but I wouldn’t be surprised if you found a slightly better value elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Cory S

customer_reviews.title: The fit and comfort were great. The black part of the sole came unglued
customer_reviews.text: The fit and comfort were great. The black part of the sole came unglued, the very first time he wore them!!! So I superglued it back together. I have never had to do that with the much cheaper water shoes!! He liked the style very much but I need the function to hold up for the price I paid. Sincerly Sandy.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Ochterski

customer_reviews.title: I love them and since I'd read that they run small ...
customer_reviews.text: I love them and since I'd read that they run small and I take a 13, and have a high instep which can be a problem especially with elastic entry stuff, but I got a 14 which allows for my instep to be comfortable. I'm actually using them to walk around in and find them both supportive and cushy enough in the heal to have me wearing them regularly around town while it stays warm... Its certainly a different feel than the usual, but I don't mind it at all. I may get another pair. Hopefully quality control will have me getting the same thing when I do.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S

customer_reviews.title: Great Aqua Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Since we live in south Florida we are avid beach goers and boaters. Recently with the algae problems we didn't want to incur lacerations on our feet and incur life threatening infections. Thus purchased these. They fit exactly as expected and were as pictured and described. They are comfortable even when wearing for long times, and quick drying. The non slip sole works well on wet rocks and boats. Most water shoes are slip on which does not work for me due to foot deformity. The laces stay tied even with the roughest of use. Very pleased with these and will purchase again if needed, however these seem to be well constructed and have not shown wear thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Islandgal

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome!
customer_reviews.text: My husband wore these on a cruise with friends and everyone was commenting on them. They look like gym shoes and fit just like them, but are perfect for the water. We went through caves in Mexico underground with water and of course rocks everywhere, and these gave him great traction and protection. it was great because some parts we had to swim and he did not slip at all. He did say that the gravel got stuck in the bottoms when we went down the gravel path, but who is using them for that? a quick tap and no more rocks. Will be buying some for myself.
customer_reviews.author: heather r.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Super lightweight and comfy! Can’t wait to use them for kayaking!
customer_reviews.author: Katelyn Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Worked well enough
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a cruise which would involve shore excursions these were recommended for. I was skeptical as they arrived in a cheap plastic bag but was pleasantly surprised when I first wore them. I'm not sure how long they will last and found out also that at least for my excursions they had free rentals so I didnt actually need to buy them. I also found they would have been cheaper to buy in the ports so I do hope im wrong on durability and that these last for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: If you are going to purchase these "water shoes" be aware that you should NOT wear them in any water that has sand or other debris. They are great at letting water in and out but when the water comes in it brings sand which has no way of getting out of the shoes. The sand will then rub on your toes and other parts of your feet; this isn't anything quite like the feeling of sandpaper on your toes.
customer_reviews.author: art/donna williams

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I got a terrible rash from the non mesh pad where the elastic lace is. Left them on vacation.
customer_reviews.author: James Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Nice water shoes
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes for a recent vacation to a lake with a stony shoreline. They worked perfectly to protect and cushion my feet. I ended up hiking 5 miles in them through all sorts of terrain which included a visit to a shallow creek bed where we waded in the water. The shoes held up to the challenge and performed their function nicely. The only thing I didn't like was small stones collect in the holes in the soles. The holes near the heel are sizable which can collect stones that you can feel. This occurred during normal wear lakeside. Overall, these are a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Hubbard

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these in light gray for a trip to Mexico where I would be doing various excursions and water sports. I have to say, they were PERFECT for just about any occasion I used them for! I didn't really use them at the beach so I can't comment about sand going in between the pores at the bottom of the shoe, but I wore them for kayaking, repelling, and just plain old sight seeing and was very impressed with how comfortable they are, but also how quick drying and and useful they were. I will be wearing these shoes to more than just occasional water activities, they really a great all purpose, comfortable, airy and light shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Works at Disney
customer_reviews.text: I bought several pairs of these for my family to take to the water parks at Disney World. They worked perfectly! True to size, water drained quickly, and much more comfy than walking barefoot along the concrete. The cinch mechanisms made them snug enough to keep on while in the giant wave pool without any problems. We also used them at a beach day, where they were equally awesome. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Christy H.

customer_reviews.title: Stop shopping and BUY These!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love these, order them! You won’t be disappointed. I ordered mine last year and took them on a trip, this year my husband got a pair too ! We were them all over the cruise ship and snorkeling shopping!! They are so comfortable, easy to put on and off. My husband suffers from plantar fasciitis, and had no problems the entire trip! These water shoes rock! (Last year I ordered him a different pair from a different company and they were horrible!)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, but can be better.
customer_reviews.text: Very good shoes, wore them on a bike tour in Kenya during the rainy season and they performed well with water. More effective drying would have been preferable, they would be moist for most of the day after getting wet, but I have no comparison and performed totallyfine as os. Definitely rocks getting stuck in the sole can be an issue. My biggest complaint is that the toe box is quite small. Otherwise, great shoes and worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: pouya

customer_reviews.title: Stood the test
customer_reviews.text: Took these to Mexico. Did a 3 hour excursion, hiking and exploring Tulum. I know they're not meant for this, but we visited a water hole after and didn't wanna pack 2 shoes, so I was ok of they didn't hold up (yes rocks can get stuck in the holes in the bottom - but again... NOT hiking shoes. I just popped them all out afterwards.) Next, we went to the Xplor waterpark. We walked around all types of caves, beaches, ziplining, etc. (No rocks here, and more of the environment these were made for). Feet weren't sore, no blisters, no ripped material. Super impressed and highly recommend. Wife's lasted as well.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Flyfishing in the Amazon!! Super Comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a shoe that was comfortable on a metal deck while flyfishing in 90 degree temp. and 90% plus humidity. Oh did I say breathable, fit well enough that I would not slip on a deck while casting for 6 plus hours a day. This shoe did that and more. I also had other fishing sandals that would not hold my feet securely, this pair was perfect. Don't hesitate to purchase this for fishing, I did not use this for walking in the water. It was perfect for 6 days of straight fishing and I plan to to bring this is on another fishing trip.
customer_reviews.author: Aunty Char

customer_reviews.title: Good for walking in the rain.
customer_reviews.text: I like that they can get soaked, dry out, and be ready to wear again without the smell sneakers/shoes get. The pair I got abraided my two right toes in my right foot as there's a cover over the inside stitching that it seems was defective so these aren't "great" but they're ok. Keep in mind there is almost zero cushion so after walking a couple of miles your heals may start to hurt but these were never intended nor sold as hiking shoes so that's not a ding against them. Overall, I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Much better than your average water shoe
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to replace the cheap water shoes we had bought at the sports supply store. One of the things we were hoping wouldn't be an issue was the sole coming out which was an ongoing problem with the cheap ones. These do have in insole that is somewhat loose, but it didn't come out every time you took off the shoes, and it seemed pretty stable in the shoe itself. They are pretty comfortable, though maybe a little tight, though being tight in the water was probably a good thing in the end. They worked well as shoes in the water and on the beach, and then walking around on pavement.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Walker

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable for in and out of water
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't go running in these water shoes, but you could comfortably wear these in and out of the water on a day at the beach and be fine. I use these to get our pier in and out of the lake each year and it helps on the rocky parts by land and helps a bit with the sludgy parts our in the seaweed beds. Fits well on my feet which usually are 2E or 4E and the cord on the ankle helps them stay secure on your foot. Would get another pair again if these ever wear out and would likely get these over the more flexible swim socks.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Really picks up the mud.
customer_reviews.text: I really like these shoes - BUT - (and this is not a problem isolated to this product) and shoe sole that has waffles or dimples, etc. will pick up a lot of dirt and small stones. This design is no different. The "water draining pores" on (in) the soles fill with clumps of mud and stones. The water does drain nicely, but you have to whack the shoes together after each use to get all that crap out. Sometimes ya gotta use a small pocketknife to get the little stones that catch in those pores out. And (at all costs) don't step on any "dog drops(?)". That can take a half hour with a toothbrush.
customer_reviews.author: Lobo67Z12abc

customer_reviews.title: Ties are annoyingly long
customer_reviews.text: The lace tie ends have big plastic caps that flop about mercilessly. If you want these snug, these caps get annoying, fast. Obviously you'd want some sort of aglet that prevents the lock thing from falling off, but the size of these border on absurd. Even tying them like normal laces doesn't help. Other than that I found them to be a bit too big, but I won't knock them for that. I returned mine and will possibly buy a size smaller after I look at everything else on the market one more time.
customer_reviews.author: SO

customer_reviews.title: Look at actual shoe lengths by size
customer_reviews.text: Love these shows. Great for vacations were you will be in and out of water. Look at the size measurement chart that gives the actual length of the shoe. I ordered 1 size to big but still work great. I do not like normal water shoes. Love flip flops but hate how the are slippery when wet
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Lyles

customer_reviews.title: Could have been better quality, and when u order them
customer_reviews.text: Could have been better quality , and when u order them , order 1 size smaller than normal , they run big
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are very comfortable and stylish with a conservative look. I appreciate the support when walking around in an area with rocks or just walking on normal surfaces. Perfect for any water sport. The shoes already fit just perfect all around but if needed, they have the capability to be snugged up a bit more if needed. The shoes are very breathable as being a good water shoe so when I am not in the water, they air out very nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Brown

customer_reviews.title: highly functional and comfortable shoe for boating or other water activities
customer_reviews.text: I have bought a second pair of these which speaks volumes. Reason I like these shoes (in no particular order): A) They provide excellent no slip traction on the deck of my sailboat which often exceeds 30 degrees of heel angle B) They are comfortable walking around on land, especially with socks C) The soles are perforated which provides great drainage and ventilation. Note: This also means your feet will get wet if you step in a puddle or walk around on wet grass or sand. D) Unlike most swimming/water shoes, these look good enough to wear when grabbing a casual meal.
customer_reviews.author: Smart Dude

customer_reviews.title: awesome water shoe
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my husband for our trip to Maui. They fit perfect! He wears a 10.5 and that is what I got, so they are true to size. I ordered a pair in all black and a pair in dark gray for him to choose. He chose the dark gray. Excellent choice, he said he could wear them for more than just a water shoe they look that good and are comfortable. I sent back the all black because he only needs one pair. My son-in law liked them so well he ordered himself a pair in all black. I totally recommend these water shoes!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nana

customer_reviews.title: Who knew?!  Great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I wear water shoes in place of gym shoes because I do not like to wear socks.... and I use them for workouts, tennis, running, hiking or most any activity. My favorite shoes (which are made by Speedo) are no longer available, so I needed to find a replacement. I ordered a couple different ones from Amazon (because at this price you can do that!) and these turned out to be my favorites! Comfy, enough support, attractive, and extremely breathable! Love them!
customer_reviews.author: M D

customer_reviews.title: Loved it - Has some flaws, but loved it nevertheless
customer_reviews.text: Until now, despite some flaws, i cant stop using it... These tennis feel wonderful on my feet, they are extremely light, I forget sometimes that i am using tennis and not splippers, I use them all the time. The plastic holder is the major issue of the shoe, because the spring isnt strong enough and sometimes it gets stuck; yes it sucks, but you can tie the cords and it works just fine. Until now money very well spent!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Seidl

customer_reviews.title: Awesome lightweight everyday shoes
customer_reviews.text: I loved these so much, I bought another pair after 3 days of walking all day in them. Light as a feather, breathable, yet sturdy enough to wear everyday at my restaurant on a hard tile floor. Machine washable of course since they are water shoes. If I could give it 6 stars, I would. I want more colors!!!! Don't love the very bright colorful strip down the middle but they are still my fav shoes in summer.
customer_reviews.author: Willie V

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Something Else
customer_reviews.text: Love/not as described shoe. The description is a hiking/water shoe. Not true. I go on river walks/hikes, so having a shoe that is durable yet flexible and breathable for water to escape is paramount. I gave a 3 star because for the river walk its a zero. But I am keeping it because when I use it forbthe water park its a perfect 5 star shoe. DO NOT buy if you plan to be in sand, dirt, pebbles etc. Perfect for places like Sea World or Raging Waters where you're going to get wet, but need a comfortable breathable shoe that expels water.
customer_reviews.author: NuEx Fitness

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe at an excellent price
customer_reviews.text: Man I was VERY pleasantly surprised on the quality of this shoe. I was expecting no arc support as I have foot issues but this show is really comfortable enough to walk around in in addition to being on the water with. I've used it on beaches and pools and have no issues with it so far and I had these for about 5 months already. These are super light and get the job done if you just want one shoe to walk around a beach town in after playing in the water.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Good, cheap water shoe
customer_reviews.text: These are easy to pack as they get quite flat, they were inexpensive and easy to put on and take off. Wore them on a trip to Costa Rica and while I would not wear them for long distances they are great for getting wet. I even wear these for quick trips to the store, they look better than I would have guessed. Not super fashionable but not weird. If you saw someone wearing these in a store you would not even think twice.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Water shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I bought because they look great and not a bad price either, I ended up not even using them for water shoes but just wearing them out with my regular clothes especially since it has been really hot where I live lately, and they look great I even had people compliment my new shoes and they were surprised when I told them that they were water shoes! I would buy another pair in a different color if I needed them in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Acceptable for what they are intended
customer_reviews.text: They provide the traction I was looking for. But they seemed somewhat narrow and too long when I received tem. After using them a few times I have mixed feelings. During water aerobics the feet tend to increase in size, despite the cooler water, because of the blood flow. The foot size increased, the shoe size slightly decreased (yes, even synthetics expand and contract to a certain degree depending on temp, so what had already been a tight fit in the width was increases. The length still looked and felt like I had flippers on. Like I said, adequate for the purpose, but I am sure there are better out there.
customer_reviews.author: PennMike

customer_reviews.title: They have the lightness of basic watershoes while incorporating more support like a running shoe
customer_reviews.text: I just got these and I am very impressed. They have the lightness of basic watershoes while incorporating more support like a running shoe. The holes on the bottom really allow them to breath to the point that if the wind blows your feet will feel it. It's that airy. They are not elastic at all to smake sure you get the proper size. For reference, I wear size 11 converse allstars. For these, 10.5 are the right size. They are slightly snug but comfortable with socks and loose and airy without. But length and width is dead on.
customer_reviews.author: P. Mansour

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: These have saved me from a lot of cuts on my feet. I'm wade fisherman in brackish water. Lots of barnacles and oysters. Not one cut yet. The gray strips on the bottom are starting to come loose after about 20 uses but it looks like they could be removed and the shoe would still perform like it should.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Patnaude

customer_reviews.title: Great for non sandy locations
customer_reviews.text: These are great for non-sandy locations. Water-parks, pool areas, etc they are absolutely the best water shoe I have ever used. However, sandy locations on the beach I found the sand and tiny sharp shell fragments would work their way up through the mesh on the bottom where the holes are and have to be constantly cleaned out, so depending on what your needs are they could be good or bad. I gave it 5 stars because they are simply that great for what they are good for.
customer_reviews.author: Willy G

customer_reviews.title: My husband likes these shoes
customer_reviews.text: My husband is a shoe person. He is very picky and likes higher end shoes. Especially tennis shoes. We needed water shoes for an upcoming float trip. He wanted to buy some brand name expensive shoes and I persuaded him to buy these since they will only be worn in the water an camping. He put them on and really likes them. He has narrow feet, and these are a little roomy. But, he liked the style and they helped me save some cash!! Now off to the river!!
customer_reviews.author: tippymicrocat

customer_reviews.title: feel strange when you walk in them but i am ...
customer_reviews.text: feel strange when you walk in them but i am going rafting in a few days and will use them anyway. Revise, worse then on the float trip, fell within 10 minutes of putting them on, the bottom of the shoes are beveled and it is like trying to walk on a tight wire.
customer_reviews.author: mark marcum

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Well Designed
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these shoes in a size 9.5 as a gift, my brother's size 9.0 was not available in sizes. Surprisingly, they fitted him perfectly as if they were a 9.0 medium width. He truly liked the lightweight mesh uppers and we found the ventilated sole to be perfect for water sports and drainage. I chose a grey color and it was a very nice shoe overall with the white sole not being too obvious. I would buy these again as I saw this almost exact style shoe without a ventilated sole in a fishing store for $59.00. Fast shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes
customer_reviews.text: I, recently, went to the beach with these shoes. They seem to perform well and were (overall) comfortable. However, they do seem to attract sand. Throughout the vacation, I beat them up a bit and they seemed to stay strong. After constant use for a couple of weeks, they held up without obvious damage or adhesion problems. These shoes would function better in a pool environment. I would purchase theses shoes again.
customer_reviews.author: MIke A.

customer_reviews.title: Looks just like shoes!
customer_reviews.text: SO Happy. My husband will not wear flip flops and tries to wear his shoes to the beach and water parks and it's a mess. These look almost identical to his actual shoes (so much so that he picked them up by mistake to wear as his regular shoes yesterday) I got them for our cruise excursions (next year) so I can't give a full review until then, I will update but as of now he absolutely loves how they look and they feel pretty good walking around in
customer_reviews.author: Kris Pas

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Beach Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with these ($15 on a lightning deal). I am a 10.5 and I bought a 44. They are snug but not at all uncomfortable, I can't step out of them. There is a fine mesh inside the sole to keep sand out but still allow water to flow through. I bought the grey ones, and as a side note, the soles were not blue as pictured, but the same color grey as the uppers. A very good looking shoe, very lightweight and sturdy. I have given them a lot of use going to the beach with no visible signs of wear.
customer_reviews.author: Longest_screen_name

customer_reviews.title: Best looking water shoes I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Bought these shoes for use on a paddle board and was truly surprised when they arrived at how nice of a shoe this is. For its purpose it's absolutely perfect. Dries quick, doesnt hold water and looks surprisingly good with shorts or Jean's. I'll actually wear this shoe a lot more often than just to the lake. It's easily as comfortable as my adidas and way lighter than any running shoes I have even. So far very pleased and would highly recommend. Only small issue is rocks get trapped in holes on bottom which can be felt at times. Easy to remove not a huge deal.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew hopper

customer_reviews.title: Great Travel Shoe!
customer_reviews.text: So I bought these for me and my wife before a 4 month trip in Asia. We traveled through Indonesia, Malaysia, Thailand, Myanmar, Cambodia, Vietnam, & Japan and I used these in almost every destination. Great for hiking, great for waterfalls, great in wet jungle environments. Easily washed in a washing machine, quick drying, and durable. My wife hated the idea of water shoes (she is a fashion designer) and she loved how they protected her feet while also protecting her good shoes. The cheap price made them perfect for a disposable travel shoe. I will rebuy
customer_reviews.author: R. Chapman

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of water shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for some water shoes reason is I live in south Florida and I love the beach. only things is at the beach on a hot sunny day is that sands can get really hot. So with these I can go from the sand to the water feet protected. Even when wet to me it does not weigh down like sandals can. I plan on buying a pair for my wife now the she has seen a real life review from me. plus I want another pair just to slip on and do errands, just can`t step in a puddle if I wear socks. I know its a dry joke. overall great product and good quality.
customer_reviews.author: DoubleAD

customer_reviews.title: Decent water shoes for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought these over some other more expensive, big brand, options for a vacation and it's not like they are intended for everyday wear. I wore them on the beach, snorkeling, and in mud pits and they performed well. Pros - Great cost. Light weight. Easy to pack. Comfortable. Easy to dry and clean. Cons - Not much cushion for all day wear. The soles will come loose when taking off if still wet, although they popped back in ready for wear.
customer_reviews.author: K.R.

customer_reviews.title: good quality, worked well
customer_reviews.text: I was between sizes so I ordered the EUR 48, normally a 47 but not available. Worked ok just adjusted the laces a little and good to go. I used them at the beach and at the pool worked well in protecting my feet. I'm originally from Florida and I've learned from expedience that getting a cut or a bruise can turn a vacation into a drag quickly. Started using these type of slipons in Guam and Hawaii where coral can be a challenge. If you can match up your size great if not go a half bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Steve M

customer_reviews.title: My go to shoe for the yard or lake
customer_reviews.text: Only complaint I have is I love shoes and now they cost more. I wear as my leisure shoe around house and yard. Yes they tend to catch pebbles or small rocks but dang they are so comfortable and easy to clean/dry UPDATE: When or if you wash these shoes DO NOT dry them in a dryer or they will shrink, the shoe will stretch back to size but the insole insert may shrink to an unusable/ uncomfortable size. I love these shoes but will apparently need to get a new pair because of my failure to see this happen.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Turpin

customer_reviews.title: Not great in gravel, pick up stones in sole.
customer_reviews.text: These are light weight and fit well, but I have one major complain. They pick up stones like no other. Stones get stuck in the holes on the sole and it can be uncomfortable to walk around with pebble stuck to your water shoes. I ended up buying some nicer shoes from Astral for 4x the price but those are much better for whitewater kayaking. Maybe for like sandy beaches or something like that they'd be fine, but if you'll be walking in gravel I wouldn't recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Great water shoes for beach/lake/boating!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these water shoes for a lake trip and they did not disappoint! They do run a bit big so think of that when ordering. Depending on the brand of shoe, I wear a 9.5 or 10 and I ordered the 9.5 to be safe. I could have gotten away with ordering a size 9 though. Like other reviews state, small pebbles/rocks do get caught up in the sole's holes but they come out very easily. The shoes are super light and very comfortable and they navigate hills much better than flip flops do. These are not designed to walk around town for many miles but if you're going to the beach or lake, they're perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Kay

customer_reviews.title: Hands down PERFECT for the lake/river/beach
customer_reviews.text: Hands down PERFECT for the lake/river/beach. They actually have a little bit of traction on those slimy rocks! They really do dry quickly and they are comfortable enough to run around in (no more sloppy wet neoprene--yay!!!), and they are as light as a feather! My boyfriend was actually surprised about how much he liked them and that they fit his feet. He's a "wide" and they are snug, but not uncomfortable as they slipped on without a struggle. You don't want them to slip off in the water so snug is good! As for the sand vs. the mesh--a quick shake of the foot in the water and bye-bye sand. These are a GREAT invention. Would DEFINITELY recommend these!!!
customer_reviews.author: CLL

customer_reviews.title: but they seem to be well made and they are comfortable. The soles offer very good traction on the ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a lot of time with these shoes, yet, but they seem to be well made and they are comfortable. The soles offer very good traction on the slimy salt water boat ramp that I use and I can climb around on my submerged boat trailer with confidence. I wear a 10.5 in street and boat shoes but would probably be better served with an 11 in this shoe. I can feel my toenails digging into the front end of theses shoes and it is bound to shorten their life a bit. If they hold up well through this summer I will re-order a half size larger.
customer_reviews.author: john W

customer_reviews.title: I have purchased 5 similar shoes on Amazon, these are my favorite
customer_reviews.text: There are several brands making a similar water shoe on amazon. I have loved everyone I have tried, but I think these have nice details and coloring. All of these shoes are extremely comfortable and airy and easy to clean. I tend to go through them quickly as they make my feet smell for some reason so after a few months of frequent wear, I do find that I have to replace them. That is the only reason I don't give them 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew D

customer_reviews.title: Know your exact shoe size!
customer_reviews.text: First of my measurements are: In Converse I’m a 12.. in Vans I’m a 12.5-13. Wide flat foot. I purchased the all black 12 with a lot of debate between the 13. 12 fits snug but good snug like Nike running shoes (worn sockless). They look great are super light and breathable. Will be using mostly for kayaking so should work. For the price they’re worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and look good
customer_reviews.text: I really like these shoes, at first I LOVED them. They are super comfortable and look really nice for a water shoe. But, then I got them wet, and then they stayed wet... for a lonnnnnnng time! Don't get me wrong these are great, and they are not any worse than the neoprene water shoes as far as dry time goes, but you would never try to wear those out and about cuz they look like hot garbage. These look nice enough to wear around town after leaving the beach, and look like they should dry quick, so you will tempted to try it, but take it from me, bring an extra pair of shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: customers might  select one size up than they would normally order.
customer_reviews.text: I did have to cut the inner strap to permit me to put the shoes on, but once I did that all was fine. They are very comfortable, and using them when in the water is just thing. More so if the beach is a bit rocky. What I reallu lke is the ability to grt out of the wanter and walk on th hot sand withou getting very hot feet.. I almost purchased a second pair, in the larger size, and will do next year.
customer_reviews.author: C. Stanley Kintner

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Just wore a this to water aerobics - great improvement over the “nothing to them” swim shoes. Cushion and support for my feet! My heel spur wasn’t hurting by the end of class. Water goes out quickly so they served as shower shoes afterwards. Did a rinse cycle with my suit as usual and they dried quickly so I can do it all over tomorrow. We’ll see how long the hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Donut

customer_reviews.title: Floating
customer_reviews.text: I’m sure if I’m not use to water shoes but these shoes made it had to drive “swim underwater” they kept forcing me up. Which is good for someone who isn’t a swimmer I guess. Also I will say. Not good for sand lol. They get all in the shoe but that’s expected for all shoes when you’re at the beach right? Outside of the swimming issue I had with them i think they’re great. Wish they was a little wider, I have wide feet, but all in all it’s pretty good and easy to put on and take off.
customer_reviews.author: Tru

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely Love, Love these water shoes. They are extremely comfortable, light weight, moderate support and great looking shoes. I can wear these with my Addidas athletic fit running pants, with my skinny jeans and they look great!! I normally wear a size 12 and I went with a 12 in these and they fit perfect, not to snug or loose, just right. Buy these shoes, you wont regret it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Billy G

customer_reviews.title: Best value shoes I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great - I have abused them for the past two months doing easy hikes, swimming, walking, and climbing around in sharp rocks. They are comfortable enough and I have even run in them. Solid traction and they dry quickly especially if you walk around in them. Maybe pushing it, but I think with socks underneath, you could pull them off with a pair of jeans or khakis well. Their only weakness is small rocks because they get stuck in the holes at the bottom and can rip the thin mesh slightly.
customer_reviews.author: justin

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes, just a snall heads up about them in the Comment i left.
customer_reviews.text: Loved the fact that they dry up super quick. The holes all around worked great. I did have a small problem with the holes on the bottom sole of the shoe. The lake I went to had a lot of gravel and small pebbles kept getting stuck in the holes causing discomfort. Not a huge Con but just something to be aware about. Aside from that the shoes are great, 2 of my buddies ordered a pair for themselves.
customer_reviews.author: ChevyMan_Z71

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy for lake/river trips (fit wasn't great either)
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these in men's 13 and woman's 8. The fit was okay, they were almost too big on the men's 13, he had almost an inch of extra rooms and they were a little tight on the woman's 8. Look really nice compared to whats out there but as the other reviews said these are not great for lakes/rivers with sand or small rocks, so that was my bad, I should have looked at different options based on that. 3-stars are for the fit, they didn't fit very well.
customer_reviews.author: Kells

customer_reviews.title: Tightening cord slips when wet.
customer_reviews.text: I like that they have thick comfortable soles and they look good. On the other hand the slip cord loosens up when wet and I had one shoe fall off when swimming and another come off while when walking in sand. When the cord is wet, the cord slips right through. Another situation of too little testing and poor quality control.
customer_reviews.author: NWPILOT

customer_reviews.title: In the boat—great; out of the boat—not so great.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes for kayaking and once in the kayak they work great. The problem is that if you walk on rocks (small or 3/4 minus) you get tons of rocks in your shoes. I work for the NPS and our boat launch where we lead tours is small gravel mostly and wood chips and they get stuck in the shoe which then makes it hard to walk on. Like I said, in the kayak they are great but not good for some surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Hensley

customer_reviews.title: Love them, need to order one size down
customer_reviews.text: I ordered exactly one size smaller as many reviews suggested and they fit perfect! Lightweight, comfortable and good design. I would definitely recommend theses water shoes, just remember to buy one size down!
customer_reviews.author: ddw

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable, like these way more than I thought I would
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't be happier with these water shoes. I bought them to have something to wear while launching our boat, but find myself wearing them around the house as well. They are comfortable like a good pair of slippers. The only negative I can find is the toggles on the laces. They kind of bang together as I walk. After about a day of that I just tied them in a bow and haven't been bothered by them since.
customer_reviews.author: R. Mcculloch

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! Comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband as well as a pair of the women's ones for me. We went on a trip to Aruba and were going to do some tours that required climbing/hiking and swimming. These were comfy enough to wear all day. They didn't hold sand or make it difficult to swim, and they dried quickly! They were sturdy enough to be able to climb on the rocks without hurting your feet. Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Chaos Coordinater

customer_reviews.title: Light weight comfort
customer_reviews.text: I use this shoe for downtime and relaxation. Originally , my first pair was used for fly fishing. As they wore out I used them when mowing the lawn. As this is my third pair , I have them for casual events and yard work . When the are worn more they will be strictly a yard shoe. Their light weight and lighter color are perfect for sweltering hot GA days.
customer_reviews.author: cath

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, fast drying shoes
customer_reviews.text: The shoes fit very well (true to fit information) and dry fast. There is a smaller mesh inside the mesh that you see from the outside of the shoe that keeps sand out when walking in the ocean. I wore them for 5 hours and they remained comfortable on the first outing. The tred on the the bottom of the shoe is not good for walking in gravel or wet ground areas as the wholes fill up with gravel and mud.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are way too short.
customer_reviews.text: I've had two other pairs of Zhuanglin mesh shoes and they fit fine. The soles of this pair are identical to the others, but the mesh upper portion is very cramped. It also has an elastic strap inside the shoe which runs over the arch of the foot and further restricts foot movement. I ended up cutting out that strap. It's better now, but still too short and uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: RET

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for any water activity!
customer_reviews.text: I am currently in Komiža, Croatia where they don't have sandy beaches. I have climbed cliffs, walked rocky shores, and swam with these water shoes. They are absolutely AMAZING! I have had no problems with them. They are super comfy, the padding is thick enough that the rocks do not bother my feet, easy to swim with, and are true to size. I loved them so much, I bought a pair for my father who loves them as well. He has tried three different water shoes prior to this pair, and this was his favorite by far! I HIGHLY suggest this product.
customer_reviews.author: Tristanie Bjazevich

customer_reviews.title: Crossfit / bike riding.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for bike riding and Crossfit. They work great. At first they feel like they might be too small because you have to kind of pull at them a little to get them on, but once they're on they don't feel tight and it feels like you put on a glove. Once they were actually on I was worried my toes would be cramped because it almost feels like they're tight, but after 5 minutes I honestly forget I was wearing shoes; You forget you have them on. Which I feel is exactly how a shoe should be.
customer_reviews.author: ApexWarBear

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: So I like these because it’s easy to wash and extremely lightweight and quite comfortable. However, walking on the beach is a sand magnet and if on grass make or anywhere with food (picnic area) be careful as ants have come inside on more than one occasion to torture me. I actually use it to workout and cycle — perfect for those activities.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Light as a feather but stink!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are incredibly lightweight and comfortable. Not only are they great for wearing in water but also on dry land. Update: After one year of use, they are still holding up. Almost from day one, I noticed that these shoes stink. When they get wet (and even if they are rinsed) saltwater will sour these shoes horribly. I have to soak them in detergent and bleach, in order to keep the smell under control.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Albright

customer_reviews.title: They sewed an ugly label on the shoe
customer_reviews.text: If U look carefully, you will see a 1/2 inch sticker/label that extends from the tip of the shoe to the your ankle. It says "S0C0NE", 5x in a row. It cannot be peeled off!...........The label is SEWN into the shoe & its very ugly & cheap looking. Dont buy! Ive never seen anything like this in my life.....Incredible
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Brasil

customer_reviews.title: No better than the cheap ones
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping to find a beach/water shoe that would not fill with sand under the insole. However, these are just like the cheaper versions on Amazon ...removable insole that MUST be removed to get the sand out. It's a pain. I would like to find a model that has generous drain holes, as these have and one-piece construction, aka non-removable insole.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: VERY lightweight and VERY comfy!
customer_reviews.text: Got some flak from my GF on the bright color, lol! These things are EXTREMELY lightweight, which is perfect for my trip to Belize. Ive had other "water socks" in the past for my trips to the Caribbean, and they all tend to have that irritating elastic that rubs the back of the ankle, or the tops of the food, and also seem to fill up with everything when using them. So far, these are as comfortable as an old worn-in pair of sneakers, and I haven't even broken them in yet!
customer_reviews.author: John Cochran

customer_reviews.title: Great seller Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great seller great product. These are the lightest water shoes I’ve owned. I bought a half size smaller than I normally wear because I don’t wear socks with them. I should have purchased my normal size which leads me to believe they run a tad on the small size. Will recommend them to family and friends!
customer_reviews.author: mwest36

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like these but one shoe was poorly manufactured. The seems did not cover part of some material that had been hot cut resulting in a very sharp nylon edge that actually cut the side of my foot when I put them on. Another pair purchased the week before was just fine so looks like a luck of the draw whether you would get a good pair or a bad pair.
customer_reviews.author: Sloan Diffley

customer_reviews.title: Great looking with some annoyances.
customer_reviews.text: Great looking, comfortable but fit a little snug on me. I normally wear wide fit sneakers from Skechers for example. The strings have plastic ends and they make a ton of noise when walking. So it’s a bit annoying. Otherwise they look great and dry easy. Like many others mentioned they are NOT they best for the beach. Sand gets in everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: hozay09

customer_reviews.title: More durable than I expected them to be. I recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for peurto rico and let me tell you...these shoes are TOP notch. I went hiking, cliff diving, walked over boulders/rocks/through mud and had no problem. They are super comfortable and to be honest, I was so surprised these held up like they did. Unfortunately at the end of my trip I left these at the hotel. I was very dissapointed but I will MOST DEFINITELY be purchasing these for my next summer vacation.
customer_reviews.author: Jed

customer_reviews.title: Shoe caused blisters and rocks get stuck in the bottom
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband and would probably return them if I could. The black shoelace loops that are threaded through the tongue of the shoe stick out and poke your skin. They were rubbing blisters on his feet. I also wouldn't recommend these for anywhere with sand or rocks. Small rocks kept getting stuck in the bottom holes.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: I think this is the Best product on the Market
customer_reviews.text: I think this is the Best product on the Market! I love these Reef Walkers, and I intend to use them on Hawaii! I just wish I had gotten a size down. I reordered a half size down and they fit better! Maybe if they had a rear pull string adjustment like the ones my wife ordered, I would like them even better! I think the feeling of them not coming off when in the water would be better, with the pull tight string on them that is.
customer_reviews.author: Dirk A.

customer_reviews.title: Quick (but not too quick) drying
customer_reviews.text: Looked for a shoe with draining in the sole - a lot of shower shoes hold water so I feel like I'm swimming inside my shoe. This shoe has great drainage. My only complaint is that the upper portion of the shoe does not dry quickly - the day after use, the upper is still damp. Not a huge issue for me but not what I was expecting from a shoe marketed as Quick Drying. I still give the shoe 4 stars for draining and comfort, so overall I'm pretty happy.
customer_reviews.author: Bippie

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and Functional
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these because they look like cross trainers he might usually wear. They wont last forever but have already been worn to more than justify what we spent so they are a great value! Worn in rivers, beaches and hiking trails. Rocks do get caught in tread but haven't noticed any that can't be removed or that are too bothersome.
customer_reviews.author: Danna

customer_reviews.title: Laces broke after one wearing
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for casual scrolls on the beach. Each walk is less than 1 hour. After the second walk and a white sand beach, I noticed that the 'laces' (elastic straps) had broken and there was not way fix them. Through them away. don't buy these - unless you need to just something to wear once.
customer_reviews.author: Charlies Pal

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: No doubt these would be perfect water shoes but I just bought them cause I thought they looked good. I wear these all the time. They are very comfortable and very light. I like the way they let your feet breathe. The only thing I've found as a con as wearing them for everyday shoes is there are holes in the bottom (for the water to run out) so if you wear them when it is raining your socks get wet. :) I've worn the all day while on my feet and they were very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: I really like these
customer_reviews.text: I really like these shoes. I fish off my boat a lot and needed something I could get wet in and not care. We are in salt water so there are oysters and other things that I wouldn’t want my bare feet on. Good protection, look like normal shoes, fit good, drain and dry very quickly. Only knock is the sole drainage holes are a little large and I get rocks stuck in them all the time - no biggie though.
customer_reviews.author: brian r conolly

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable, check your size to their dimensions.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered my size and they were a little loose without socks (and they are water shoes) so I returned and reordered 1/2 a size down and they fit perfectly. Easily the most comfortable and lightest shoes I've ever owned. If you hate socks in the summer, work or play around the water, these are great. The nearly flat sole also offers superior grip on wet surfaces by maximizing contact surface area. I'll buy them again when I wear these out. Might even order a pair for the office.
customer_reviews.author: DMB

customer_reviews.title: Look like sneakers
customer_reviews.text: The best aspect of these water shoes is the look. No one would know these are not regular sneakers. They are comfortable enough to wear sockless in the warm weather. As far as in the water, they will gather sand due to the holes in they soul, but the do drain well and dry amazingly fast. After wearing the for acwhile, you might have to remove small rocks from the sole, but otherwise a nice water shoe that does not look like a typical water shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Seem good but unsure about longevity seeing as I’ve been staying home more.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for a family vacation we had planned but sadly covid happened. Although I have found a few times to wear these and they have worked out pretty good. They give good grip and hold on to your foot well. I’m not sure how long these will last if I was to really put them through what my summers used to be but I would most likely continue to buy these seeing as they do seem to perform well.
customer_reviews.author: Dereck hill

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes for a Pool
customer_reviews.text: My autistic son would get cuts on his feet from our concrete pool deck (yeah, first world problems, I know). He went through a few pair of cheaper water shoes until we found these. They fit great, seem comfortable for him, don't slip, and don't have soles that can loosen and flop around. He loves them and asks for his "shoes" when he goes out to the pool now. I can see how sand might be a problem with them, but if you're not on a beach, these are highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Zhuanglin Men's Quick Drying Aqua Water Shoes
feature_bullets: Breathable and durable air mesh upper allow the foot to breathe
Solyte midsole provides an exceptionally lightweight midsole with excellent bounce-back and durability
Water Grip outsole provides exceptional traction in wet and slippery conditions
ComforDry sockliner provides the optimum cushioning performance that creates a cooler, drier and healthier shoe environment.
Open mesh on the upper and hole on the sole provides for superior breathability and quick drying
